Now, Christ left us His work when He went away, and He said, "Lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world." We are not left alone in the hands of the devil. Do you think our heavenly 
                                                                           79
Father would leave us alone to carry on the work of redemption and bringing up the fallen race, that He would leave us in a world flooded with evil with no help, no support, after He had endured the agonies of the cross? Do you think He will leave us now?--No! Says the Saviour, "Lo, I am with you alway, even unto the end of the world." And again, "If I go away I will come again." "If ye shall ask any thing in my name, I will do it." This is on the condition that we keep His commandments. Is not this a blessed promise? Why do we not talk of it more and praise God for it? Here are the precious promises of the Word of God to us, and why do we not take them?
